content.description:
One of the many three star 5.12a routes at the Belfry, Bladerunner climbs the massive main corner system of the blocky  overhangs. Slightly overhanging, big holds, and a cryptic boulder problem crux that guards the chains are the hallmark of this route.

Start on the blocks and climb off the right side of them. Take the line of bolts that goes straight up the corner (busting out right at the big roof takes you onto the Replicant, 5.13c/d).
10 bolts, fixed draws.

climbs.name: Blue Little Pill (Erect Finish)
climbs.fa: Prep: Hugh Lenny,  FA: Doug Orr

content.description:
Head up a series of ledges with strait forward climbing until the wall kicks back and the business begins.  Plan a difficult clip over the largest roof and hang on for some punchy climbing to a quick shake out.  Two finishes are possible.   The “erect finish” takes the direct line to the chains past a few small crimps to a hard stab.  The easier finish cuts to the right after the last clip.   



Two routes right of the obvious Blade Runner corner

10 bolts

Face climb to a ledge at the 4th bolt before starting the real climbing. From here, bucket slam up to a rest, and then repeat again. 

Angle right, along the right leaning crack to a high perch before a final, blind boulder. Angle left out of the overhang and rock up onto the slab. Only clip one of the anchor bolts, clipping both spins your rope. 



Identify the left leaning ramp/corner with perma draws. This is the first line to the left, which has a perma draw by the right leaning crack ~20m off the deck. 

12 bolts, fixed anchor with biners

Climb the shared start of "Blade Runner" through easy terrain, clipping the left perma-draws when the lines split. Pull around the arete to the left and into the overhang.

Smash your way up big holds to the roof split by a crack. A 2-bolt, one chain perma-draw protects the roof boulder crux which involves a big, blind move and more than a little bit of upper body strength! After you turn the roof, you shouldn't fall, all that remains is a short section of face/slab climbing on good, big holds!



Look for the telltale "Replicant" overhang; "Blade Runner" goes up the dihedral to the left, this line splits off of "Blade Runner" down low and crosses the arete to the left of the dihedral. Look for the crack in the roof perhaps 16 m off the deck. 

10 perma-draws, chains+biners.

A straightforward overhanging climb right up to the end where things start amping up a few notches. Great fun with lots of sailing potential.

Near the middle of the wall. Starts on top of the big block along with a handful of other enjoyable climbs, moving left to start.
8 bolts, fixed chain on the second last bolt. According to CBarber in the comments, the last bolt is new and many people skip it as it's hard to clip and the fall is good.

Punchy for the grade, but a great climb nonetheless. A longer crux than some might anticipate for 5.11b, but the holds keep working out. Clipping the anchors from below is a good idea - there isn't exactly a huge finishing jug on this one.

Start just left of Sex Machine, clip a bolt, then climb up to the fixed draw of Goin Sailin' (just left of this route), climb up and left one or two moves depending on your height, then bust right to the jug next to the third bolt. Head straight up from there.
7 bolts.

Fun, route with a sweet/hard move up high.

The wall just under the Replicant overhang. There are two grooves on the wall, and this route enters and exits the right one. Look for the left facing corner up high.
10 bolts.

climbs.name: Priapism
climbs.fa: Cody Leydon (b), Hugh Lenney (b), Doug Orr (fa) 2007

content.description:
Easy start leads to pronunced crux. Great movement on amazing rock.

Farthest left line on the wall underneath Replicant (5.13d, fixed draws).
9 bolts.

Start as for Bladerunner but break right, following fixed draws out the steep hanging wall, to an endurance crux (Chipped by an American) at the end. Original graded 13d and still it most places but I have done many 13a's which are harder. If you climb low 13 get on it you will be surprised.



Bladerunner


Fixed Draws

Fun and technical climbing up an arete left of Rock Soft



Just to the left of Rock Soft (the obvious corner crack) is a clean arete which you follow to the same steep finishing roof

13 bolts

Cruise several bolts of broken face (5.6) to a no hands ledge. Cruise your way up the crack/corner (5.6) to a no hands rest just under the roof, then slam your way through the roof on big holds to the chains!

Super cruisey climbing until the roof, but it earns the grade quickly! 



Towards the right side of the Belfry, look for the perma-draw line that leads up the corner to the roof. The perma's on the arete are "Rock Hard", both routes share the same start and finish.

All fixed draws

A nice, pumpy overhanging line that goes up the corners up on the ledge at the right side of the Belfry area. Most will use this as a warm-up, although long reaches may annoy the shorter folk. The holds, though, are HUGE.

Starts on the ledge on the right side of the Belfry, then goes up on the left side of a long roof through a corner system.
9 bolts.

Start as for "Orrgazmo" climbing through easy terrain interspersed with no-hands rests until the bolt line splits. Head left into more sustained climbing on decent holds. The pump builds through the slight overhang until you pull into the "womb" for a good stem rest. Finish out on good holds (easier) to chains directly above the "womb" (they're there even though you can't see them!)

This route lacks a clearly defined crux. Or, possibly it's right as you pull into the "womb" alcove. 



Identify the monster "Replicant" overhang. On the face under the the overhang, look for the first alcove (womb) ~17-18 m off the deck, aim for this. 

10 bolts, 2 bolt anchor
Shady in the morning, but known to get hot hot hot in the afternoons. A solid collection of challenging, pumpy, overhung, technical routes.
